Sensors that let you monitor the motion of a device such as tilt, shake, rotation, or swing "Provides mobile phones with a simple orientation in relation to the Earth's magnetic field. As a result, your phone always knows which way is North so it can auto rotate your digital maps depending on your physical orientation." This is the sensor which is used to maintain and control the position, level or orientation based on the principle of angular momentum. It works with an Accelerometer to detect the rotation of phone and features like tilting of phone to play racing games enhances the overall gaming experience. Measures the ambient light level (illumination) in lx. Sensors which most device manufacturers use to control screen brightness "Measures the ambient geomagnetic field for all three physical axes (x, y, z) in Î¼T" "Measures the proximity of an object in cm relative to the view screen of a device. This sensor is typically used to determine whether a handset is being held up to a person's ear."
"Hi there, I'm using â€œAVS Background Recorder" app , click to get it now:-"
"Hidden Bugs Detector/IR Camera Detector is a free app which works on every smartphone and android. It can be downloaded from Google Play free of cost. Open the app after installation and enjoy easy to use interface to set it to working. It's a very easy-to-use and handy app which is used around the globe on account of its portability and efficiancy.
Hidden Bugs Detector/IR Camera Detector detect hidden bugs through two methods.
1-Infrared Camera Detector: Infrared light cannot seen through nacked eye, while using IR detector if you see any white dot on your screen that could be infrared light, search for hidden camera there. Camera Lens are mostly placed in many things like pen, ballpoint, button, glass, table etc.
2- Radiation Detector: All hidden devices like Microphone, cameras or speakers emits radiations which cannot seen, through radiation detector users can find the intensity of radiations emitted by hidden devices. if radiation value gets high, then search for hidden devices around you like cameras, microphones, speakers,tv,radio other electronic devices etc."

Terms and Conditions Privacy Policy
Following permission must be granted \n in order for tha application to work \n properly. \n Would you line to grant them now?
Q: Is it safe? A: Yes, it is safe and secure. We do not collect personal information from user. All data generated by this app will be saved on your device. We never use, transfer or back up user data. Q: Is there any way to recover the deleted files? A: No, deleted video cannot be recovered. Since we do not back up your data, we could not do this. The recorded videos are saved on your internal or external SD card. Q: Why is the notification icon displayed during video recording? Is there a way to remove it? A: If we do not display notifications, Android will not allow video recording in the background. But you can change the application name, icon notification icon on the settings screen. Q: Why does recording stop when a video file size reached 3GB (about 30 minutes)? A: The default, Android system will stop a recording when a file size reached 3GB or duration is 30 minutes. Or if you are saving file on SD Card you should format SD Card is exFAT instead of FAT so the app can record video long time (more 30 minutes). Q: Why the volume key does not work when the device is locked for a while? A: This is because Android disables the volume buttons when the device is locked for a long time. You can use the power button for this situation. In addition, you can shake your device and make video recording. You must enable these features on the Settings screen. Q: Why doesn\'t the volume key work when you are talking on the phone or listening to music? A: Since hardware volume buttons are shared resources, only one application can use them simultaneously. While you are talking on the phone, the phone application gets the right to the buttons. All other applications can not use it at the moment.
